content:
• Tuesday, December 13, 2016
  • PBF

    PBF Energy to launch 10M-share offering

    • PBF Energy (NYSE:PBF) -3% AH after announcing a public offering of 10M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.5M shares.
    • PBF says it plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, including debt repayment, working capital, capital expenditures and potential acquisitions.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM
  • JNJ

    Johnson & Johnson backs away from Actelion

    • Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) has reportedly ended its negotiations with Actelion Pharmaceuticals (OTCPK:ALIOF) about a possible merger. J&J had made a $20B ($250/share) for the Basel, Switzerland-based biopharma firm, up from its original offer of $17B after Actelion resisted.
    • Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) is reportedly mulling a bid as well.
    • Update: In a statement, J&J says its was unable to reach an agreement that it believed would "create adequate value" for its shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM | 25 Comments
  • VCEL

    FDA OKs Vericel's autologous cell therapy for cartilage repair in the knee; shares ahead 48% after hours

    • Thinly traded nano cap Vericel (NASDAQ:VCEL) is up 48% after hours on robust volume in response to the FDA approval of Maci (autologous cultured chondrocytes on porcine collagen membrane) for the repair of symptomatic full-thickness cartilage defects of the knee in adult patients.
    • Maci consists of a patient's own (autologous) cells that are expanded in the laboratory and placed onto a bio-resorbable (can be broken down in the body) porcine-derived collagen membrane. The engineered tissue is then surgically placed over the damaged/defective area. Multiple implants can be used if there is more than one defect.
    • It is the first product that uses the process of tissue engineering to grow cartilage cells on a scaffold to gain FDA approval.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM | 4 Comments
  • ENT

    Global Eagle up 20% on extension of Southwest Airlines contract

    • Global Eagle Entertainment (ENT +1.7%), up 20% after hours, has entered into a new deal with Southwest Airlines that runs through the end of 2025.
    • In a filing, the company notes that deal includes a full-term commitment for live TV service as well as a transition in the middle of next year to a monthly recurring charge per aircraft for Wi-Fi and TV service.
    • There's an additional rate card for ancillary services provided, Global Eagle says. The company has agreed on terms for a major transponder purchase to support Southwest.
    • The company's hosting a webcast to discuss details of the deal tomorrow at 8:30 a.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • EGLE

    Eagle Bulk Shipping launches $100M private placement

    • Eagle Bulk Shipping (NASDAQ:EGLE) -6.4% AH after announcing a private placement of ~22.2M common shares at $4.50/share.
    • EGLE says gross proceeds will total $100M, to be used for the acquisition of dry bulk vessels and general corporate purposes.
    • EGLE's board will hold a special meeting of shareholders to approve the placement.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • FOX

    Football drives another ratings win for NBC

    • NBC (CMCSA +1.4%) rode football to another win in the Nielsen ratings this week, with NFL programming taking up the top three programs and leading the Peacock past CBS.
    • NBC drew 10.61M viewers on average for prime time, to 7.76M for CBS (CBS +1.5%). Fox (FOX +2.7%, FOXA +2.7%) and ABC (DIS -0.2%) tied with 4.49M each.
    • On cable, Fox News ruled again with 2.51M prime-time viewers on average, ahead of Hallmark's 2.27M (it is the holiday season) and ESPN's 2.22M. And NBC prevailed among evening news, averaging 9.18M viewers to ABC's 9.11M.
    • In top individual programs, NBC's Dallas-New York and Oakland-Kansas City NFL games were first and third with 26.5M and 17.4M viewers respectively, and the network's Sunday pre-kick show was No. 2 with 19M. Rounding out the top five were NCIS on CBS (14.69M) and Football Night in America on NBC (12.91M).
    • Among cable shows, the half-season mark of The Walking Dead (AMCX +1%) settled into 11th place with 10.59M viewers.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: NDSN +7%. DSX +7%. SGYP +5%. GLF +4%. RICK +4%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25 p.m.: EGLE -6%. CPE -2%. ABM -2%. HTZ -2%. SIRI -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • HTZ

    Hertz names Marinello as new president/CEO; Icahn approves

    • Hertz Global Holdings (HTZ +10.6%) has tapped Kathryn Marinello as its new president and CEO, effective Jan. 3, earning an "excited" reaction from the company's biggest shareholder, Carl Icahn.
    • John Tague will retire from those positions the day before.
    • Shares are 3.3% lower after hours.
    • "I am excited about Hertz and its prospects with Kathy at the helm," Icahn said in a statement. "Kathy has a history as a proven CEO and I believe she is the right person to lead Hertz as we move forward. Her consistent track record of successes in consumer and financial services, as well as technology businesses, is impressive. She was extremely well-regarded at GE and successfully turned around Ceridian and Stream."
    • Marinello served in a number of leadership roles at General Electric and was CEO of Ceridian Corp. from 2006-2010, and chairman, president and CEO of Stream Global Services from 2010-2014. She's since served as senior adviser of Ares Management.
    • In addition, the company's three longest-serving directors will leave the boards of Hertz Global Holdings and Hertz Corp. on Jan. 2. After Linda Fayne Levinson (non-executive chair), Carl Berquist and Michael Durham leave their seats, the boards will have seven directors, six of them independent.
    • Previously: Hertz spikes off of Icahn rumor (Dec. 13 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 19 Comments
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum to buy Delaware Basin acreage for $615M

    • Callon Petroleum (NYSE:CPE) -2.8% AH after agreeing to acquire undeveloped acreage and producing oil and gas properties in west Texas from American Resource Development for $615M.
    • The deal marks CPE's initial entry into the Delaware Basin, with properties currently producing 1,945 boe/day (71% oil), including production from 20 gross operated horizontal wells producing from the Wolfcamp and Bone Spring formations.
    • To help fund the deal, CPE launches a 34M-share public offering, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 5.1M common shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • NDSN

    Nordson beats by $0.15, beats on revenue

    • Nordson (NASDAQ:NDSN): FQ4 EPS of $1.39 beats by $0.15.
    • Revenue of $509M (+14.1% Y/Y) beats by $26.91M.
    • Shares +3.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • HEI

    HEICO beats by $0.03, misses on revenue

    • HEICO (NYSE:HEI): FQ4 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $363.3M (+10.5% Y/Y) misses by $9.36M.
    • Shares +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • CNOB

    Another bank secondary

    • The capital raises from banks are coming at a furious pace, with the latest from ConnectOne Bancorp (NASDAQ:CNOB). It's offering $35M worth of stock, or $40.25M if the underwriters exercise their greenshoe.
    • CNOB is up 38% YTD, with nearly the entirely of that gain coming since early November.
    • Shares -1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp +2.1% as Aegis launches coverage at Buy on margin expansion

    • Yelp (NYSE:YELP) closed up 2.1% today after a launch at Buy from Aegis Capital.
    • The company is pursuing new product opportunities to expand its margins, writes the firm's Victor Anthony. He has a price target of $47, implying 31% upside from today's price.
    • Most analysts are evenly split between Buy and Hold ratings on the shares. Last week, Macquarie reiterated its Outperform rating (and price target of $49); after earnings last month, Baird and Needham took the opportunity to boost price targets (to $40 and $43 respectively).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • IHRTQ

    IHeartMedia leaving $57M in notes held by Clear Channel on books

    • Amid a capital restructuring, iHeartMedia (IHRT +4%) has decided not to repay $57.1M of 5.5% senior notes held by its affiliate Clear Channel Holdings that are due on Thursday, and filed a lawsuit in connection with that move.
    • Another $192.9M of the notes held by others will be paid in full -- but keeping the $57.1M on the books frees iHeartMedia from an obligation to grant some security interests in favor of some of its debtholders (via a so-called "springing lien").
    • The company's lawsuit is seeking a declaration that those notes remain outstanding and that the company doesn't have to grant the "springing lien" on any assets.
    • It's been engaged in disputes this year with creditors over stock-transfer moves among its affiliates.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:30 PM

    • Gainers: INVE +18%. IDN +12%.WTT +10%. ASUR +9%.
    • Losers: INOV -36%. MODN -10%. VHC -10%. AVID -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • AAPL

    Mega-cap tech trading hot

    • Apple (AAPL +2.2%), Amazon (AMZN +2.4%), Microsoft (MSFT +1.6%), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) and Facebook (FB +2.5%) are continuing to elevate through December, at this point respectively higher by 9.4%, 8.2%, 8.8%, 8.8%/9% and 4.8% on a 1-month term (November 14).
    • Not the only movers in the space, high-profile companies ranging from IBM and Intel to Qualcomm, Oracle and others are also on strong momentum, with many names having fully recovered from a widespread sell-off briefly overcoming the sector earlier this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 66 Comments
  • ATW

    Atwood, Rowan among oil services stocks primed for takeout, analyst says

    • Offshore drillers Atwood Oceanics (ATW +1.9%) and Rowan (RDC +0.3%), as well as Oceaneering International (OII +3.1%), Helix Energy Solutions (HLX +0.3%) and Flotek Industries (FTK -2.9%) are the favorite takeout candidates among oilfield services stocks for Stephens analyst Matthew Marietta.
    • As Marietta says today's Patterson-UTI (PTEN -7.3%) "well-priced takeout" of Seventy Seven Energy attests, the firm believes M&A in the sector will remain prevalent and continues to see deal-flow potential in well-capitalized companies with technology differentiation or top tier asset quality.
    • Marietta believes confidence is becoming restored in oilfield services company management teams and that the potential accelerates for the IPO market to heat up.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 17 Comments
  • NSM

    Challenging outlook for mortgage banks - KBW

    • KBW has ratcheted up its baseline projection for rates hikes - now seeing five through 2018 vs. a just one previously. That means slowing mortgage origination activity - $1.55T estimated for next year vs. $1.83T previously.
    • It's not all bad for specialty servicers like Nationstar Mortgage (NSM -0.5%), which can offset weaker mortgage banking profitability with lower prepays on its servicing portfolio. Analyst Bose George, however, does cut Walter Investment (WAC -10.6%) to Underperform from Market Perform.
    • Though pricey, mortgage insurers are well positioned to grow earnings, and George lifts estimates for industry-wide insurance in force growth to 7% from 5%, and cites Essent Group (ESNT -4.1%) and NMI Holdings (NMIH -0.5%).
    • Lower refi volumes are likely to hurt title insurers , but growth in the purchase market should partially offset. He keeps Fidelity National (FNF -0.2%) and First American (FAF +0.8%) at Market Perform, but cuts Stewart Information (STC -5.4%) to Underperform on valuation.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Rough session for mREITs as bull turns cautious (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • GOL

    Gol Linhas rallies after load factor moves higher

    • Gol Linhas (GOL +3.3%) trades higher after reporting a huge improvement in load factor for November.
    • Load factor improved 460 bps to 77.8% after revenue miles outpaced capacity growth (domestic ASKs -5%, international ASKs -17%) during the month.
    • Shares of Gol Linhas are up 3.41% to $13.63 vs. a 52-week trading range of $2.43 to $27.08.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • TEX

    Terex hits two-year high after laying out restructuring, 2020 goals

    • Terex (TEX +7.4%) trades at two-year highs following an Investor Day presentation where the company laid out its strategy through 2020.
    • TEX sees FY 2017 net sales of ~$4B with a 5% operating margin and $100M-$150M in free cash flow; it sees ~1% organic revenue compound annual growth rate with an operating margin above 10% and return on invested capital above 20% vs, ~6% today.
    • In returning capital to shareholders, TEX says it also plans a double digit annual percentage increase in the dividend and $1B-$1.5B in cumulative share repurchases through 2020.
    • TEX stock has been a big beneficiary of the Trump trade, up ~40% since the Nov. 8 election and 75% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYS

    Rough session for mREITs as bull turns cautious

    • KBW's Bose George now sees five Fed rate hikes by the end of 2018 vs. his previous estimate of just one. He lowers his sector (REM -1.3%) estimates by 4% for 2017 and 2018.
    • Downgraded to Market Perform from Outperform are CYS Investments (CYS -2.5%), and Invesco Mortgage (IVR -3.9%).
    • Annaly (NLY -1.2%), AGNC Investment (AGNC -1.1%), MTGE Investment (MTGE -2.6%), New York Mortgage (NYMT -2.2%), Capstead (CMO -2.5%), Western Asset (WMC -2.6%), AG Mortgage (MITT -3.3%)
    • ETFs: MORT, MORL
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 51 Comments

    • Losers: YUMA -18%. DELT -17%. NOG -12%. NWPX -10%. UEC -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors revisits $200

    • Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) jumps 4.08% to jump over $200 for the first time since late October.
    • The biggest news in the automobile industry today is Google's decision to spin off its self-driving car project into a stand-alone company called Waymo.
    • Waymo won't be a manufacturer, but will focus on the technology side of autonomous driving, including keeping an eye on ride-sharing services and long-haul trucking.
    • Previously: Report: Google scales back self-driving car ambitions (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 164 Comments
  • LIFE

    Early-stage data on aTyr Pharma's Resolaris mixed; shares slump 22%

    • Thinly traded nano cap aTyr Pharma (LIFE -21.9%) heads south on a 4x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 417K shares, in response to its announcement of results from several early-stage studies assessing lead product candidate Resolaris in adults with limb-girdle muscular dystrophy 2B (LGMD2B) or facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy (FSHD), two rare genetic disorders characterized by muscle weakness and wasting.
    • Top-line results from the Phase 1b/2 study (004 Trial) showed improvements in muscle strength from baseline in seven of nine patients treated with 3.0 mg/kg of Resolaris twice weekly for 12 weeks, although only one surpassed a 10% improvement (~21%) as measured by manual muscle testing (MMT) scores. Analyses of various biomarkers were not able to establish robust signals of efficacy.
    • Interim data from four subjects an ongoing Phase 1b/2 study (003 Trial) in early-onset FSHD patients showed two patients with slight decreases in disease burden and one with an increase as measured by a quality-of-life questionnaire called INQoL.
    • Data from another study (002 Trial) showed no significant trends in either MMT or INQoL scores in four patients who received at least six months of therapy.
    • The overall discontinuation rate was 31% (n=11/35).
    • Resolaris is an intravenous protein therapeutic derived from naturally occurring protein released by human skeletal muscle cells.
    • The company intends to advance development of Resolaris. It also plans to meet with the FDA next year to discuss a regulatory pathway towards a Biologics License Application (BLA).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 3 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: LMRK +9%. IRET +8%. PN +8%. IFMI +6%.
    • Losers: WAC -10%. JTPY -8%. NSA -6%. SIEB -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • VIVHY

    Mediaset +24% as Vivendi hints at possible hostile pursuit

    • After a contentious year featuring a fight over an aborted TV operations deal, increasingly acquisitive Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) says now that it could seek a 20% stake in Mediaset (OTCPK:MDIUY +24.4%) en route to launching a hostile takeover of the Italian company.
    • Vivendi has just over 3% of Mediaset now. In the summer it backed out of a deal to buy Mediaset's pay TV operations, launching a pitched cross-border battle between the two.
    • "Vivendi intends to carry on its purchase of shares in Mediaset, depending on market conditions, to become, if possible, the second industrial shareholder in Mediaset, which to begin with could represent 10 to 20% of Mediaset's capital," Vivendi said.
    • "Vincent Bollore and Vivendi have shown what their true intentions towards Mediaset were from the very start," said a statement from Fininvest, the holding company of former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi, which controls Mediaset.
    • Mediaset's Premium TV business (or the whole company) would represent another piece in a southern Europe strategy for the French media giant, which is also the biggest shareholder at Telecom Italia (TI +1.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: USEG +54%. GLF +21%. OPGN +17%. AKAO +15%. BCEI +13%. INVE +11%. [[]] +%. IDN +10%. INFU +10%. NVCN +10%.
    • Losers: PRTO -73%. INOV -35%. APRI -22%. LIFE -21%. DELT -16%. ATOS -13%. GLBS -12%. LFVN -11%. PSDV -11%. VHC -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • ONVO

    Organovo presents encouraging preclinical survival and functionality data on 3D bioprinted liver tissue; shares up 9%

    • Organovo (ONVO +8.8%) perks up on double normal volume in apparent response to the release of positive preclinical data on its 3D bioprinted human liver tissue. The results were presented at the TERMIS-Americas Meeting in San Diego.
    • Company scientists implanted patches of its 3D human liver tissue onto the livers of NOD/SCID mice which have been engineered to have weakened immune systems (ideal model for xenograft research). After 28 days, the tissues remained intact and well tolerated. Analyses of tissue samples revealed the presence of key human metabolic enzymes associated with inborn errors of metabolism.
    • Organovo says a bioprinted liver patch has potential to treat acute-on-chronic liver failure and pediatric inborn errors of metabolism. It plans to file an Investigational New Drug (IND) application with the FDA for therapeutic liver tissue in three to five years.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 10 Comments
  • OPGN

    Opgen up big but can't hold onto gain

    • Thinly traded nano cap Opgen (OPGN +20.6%) is up on a colossal 71x surge in volume (over 20M turnover). Shares peaked at $3.10 (+158%) before retracing. No particular news accounts for the extraordinary action.
    • The company provides molecular testing services via its CLIA-certified laboratory that are used to identify multi-drug-resistant organisms (MDRO). Its lead offering is the Acuitas MDRO Gene Test that directly detects 10 genes unique to MDRO from swab or clinical isolate samples.
    • Last month, the company inked a collaboration with Merck (MRK -0.4%) to develop rapid diagnostics and information technology products to fight the threat of antimicrobial resistance.
    • Shares have been in a downtrend since debuting at $6/unit (stock and warrant) in May 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 3 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: PAY +7%. THST +7%. ZX +7%. JOUT +7%.
    • Losers: LFVN -14%. HOFT -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    Reactions to Chipotle's new look

    • Chipotle (CMG -1.4%) is on the radar of analysts and shareholders after the company reset strategy yesterday.
    • During a conference call late yesterday, Chipotle CEO Steve Ellis said the running of the company's restaurants has become too complicated. The hiring of a new COO is expected to help set the chain back on the right path.
    • Shareholder CtW Investment Group sent out a warning shot to Pershing Square Capital Morning (~10% CMG holder) this morning.
    • "Replacing two or more incumbent directors with diverse candidates experienced in effective human capital management should be the highest immediate priority for the company," said CtW executive director Dieter Waizenegger.
    • The view from Wall Street on Chipotle shifting away from the dual CEO model is mixed. Deutsche Bank doesn't see a timely turnaround for the restaurant chain, while Nomura ses a clear pivot from food safety to operations. Bullish-leaning SunTrust thinks Chipotle can improve its through-put (line speed) and customer satisfaction ratings under the new structure.
    • On Seeking Alpha, Mitch Dol weighs in. "No doubt Chipotle is going through a temporary problem, and I'm betting it will recover to become one of the world's great restaurant chains," he writes.
    • Sources: Bloomberg and Reuters
    • Previously: Chipotle names Ellis sole CEO (Dec. 12)
    • Previously: Chipotle founder plans to make it simple again (Dec. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 33 Comments
  • SNP

    Bloomberg: Sinopec eyes takeover of Gulf Keystone Petroleum

    • Sinopec (SNP +2%) is considering a takeover of Kurdistan-based oil producer Gulf Keystone Petroleum (OTCQX:GUKYF +3.6%), Bloomberg reports.
    • Gulf Keystone is said to have been approached by the Chinese group, and may also attract other bidders.
    • Gulf Keystone was taken over by creditors in September after missing a bond payment and was forced to restructure its debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: OPGN +63%. AKAO +14%. DPRX +12%. ONVO +10%. CERC +10%.
    • Losers: PRTO -74%. APRI -22%. LIFE -21%. AVXL -13%. ATOS -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 6 Comments
  • CMLS

    Cumulus Media launches note exchange, says most holders participating

    • Cumulus Media (CMLS -2.1%) says most noteholders have agreed to participate in a private exchange offer it's launching in a refinancing support agreement.
    • The company launched a private exchange offer for any and all of its 7.75% senior notes due 2019, and holders of 57.3% of aggregate principal (about $349.7M) agreed to tender notes in the offer.
    • The company won't retain any cash proceeds and the notes will retired and canceled.
    • If 100% of principal is retired and canceled, former noteholders will hold about 33.3% of common equity and the company will have retired $610M in indebtedness (through the outstanding notes) and incurred $305M in indebtedness via revolving loans.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • LFVN

    Lifevantage F16 top-line up 9%; soft guidance sinks shares, down 17%

    • After the close yesterday, Lifevantage (LFVN -16.5%) reported fiscal 2016 revenue of $206.5M (+8.5%) and EPS of $0.41 (-16.1%). Non-GAAP EPS increased 31.8% to $0.62.
    • Fiscal Q1 results (quarter ended September 30) were EPS of $0.08 (0%) on revenues of $54.9M (+21.0%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Revenue: $207M - 212M (+0 - 3%); Non-GAAP EPS: $0.40 - 0.47 (-35 - 24%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • HIMX

    Himax Technologies downgraded at Mizuho Securities

    • Firm lowers rating from Buy to Neutral and target from $10 to $7.70 (current price $6.56).
    • With a sharp downward move materializing early, share loss for Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) is brought to a roughly 11% total on the week.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 24 Comments
  • HTZ

    Hertz spikes off of Icahn rumor

    • Hertz Global (NYSE:HTZ) sails higher amid M&A speculation.
    • The talk going around is that Icahn Enterprises (IEP -0.8%) is talking to other potential bidders for a run at Hertz.
    • Shares of Hertz are up 3.39% to $23.50 on volume approaching 500K.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 6 Comments
  • BRK.A

    Berkshire Hathaway tops $250K per share

    • Nearly 54 years ago to the day, The Oracle put in his first buy order for the textile maker, and paid $7.50 each for his initial 2K share stake.
    • A mere two years later, Warren Buffett was looking to exit his (then larger) position for $11.50 each, and thought he had a verbal agreement from Berkshire's owner for just that. When the formal written offer arrived at a few pennies less, a ticked-off Buffett instead began aggressively buying more.
    • The rest is history, and today the Class A shares of Berkshire (NYSE:BRK.A) topped $250K for the first time ever.
    • Since the election, BRK is higher by 13%, about doubling the S&P 500's performance. Year-to-date, BRK is up 26.6% vs. the S&P's 11.6% advance.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 18 Comments
  • SYNA

    Synaptics announces new fingerprint sensors, new OLED DDIC and collaboration with OXi Technology

    • Synaptics updates on a new suite of biometric authentication solutions enabling high-resolution fingerprint scanning through 1mm of full-cover glass, a new OLED DDIC offering to enhance display technologies and collaboration with OXi Technology to develop new proprietary optical sensing products for smartphones, tablets and PC devices.
    • Shares (NASDAQ:SYNA) are up 1.9% early.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • DVA

    Baird downgrades DaVita on weak expected organic growth; shares slip 3%

    • DaVita (DVA -2.5%) stumbles out of the blocks this morning on the heels of a downgrade by Baird. Analyst Whit Mayo cut his rating to Neutral from Outperform but increased the price target to $69 (6% upside) from $68.
    • He cites expectations of "tepid organic growth" unless the payer mix improves.
    • In November, the company stopped supporting a charity that provided premium assistance for certain patients after CMS stated that Medicaid beneficiaries are not eligible for federal subsidies or premium credits. The company says the situation may affect ~2K of its dialysis patients who have extra coverage through an ADA plan. If CMS forbids charitable assistance for all dialysis patients on ACA plans, it would trim ~$230M off net income.
    • Five shops still rate the stock a Buy with price targets ranging from $70 - 75.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Wells Fargo: T-Mobile purchase might cost Sprint $93.4B

    • If a changing presidential administration finally makes for a Sprint/T-Mobile merger, it won't be cheap, says Wells Fargo's Jennifer Fritzsche.
    • Sprint (S +0.5%) might have to open up its wallet to the tune of $90B-plus in such a deal, she writes -- which could mean that even in an amenable regulatory environment, the cost may be too high.
    • T-Mobile's (TMUS +1.6%) likely price is around $93.4B, she says, 8.5 times estimated EBITDA for fiscal 2017. That accounts for a 28% premium to T-Mobile equity and Sprint assuming $33B in T-Mobile net debt.
    • The two could save by cutting jobs and ad/marketing budgets along with consolidating billing systems, and line up spectrum portfolios in an optimal fashion. But even in Trumpworld there may be resistance to a three-carrier universe.
    • “Interestingly, Sprint/T-Mobile would have more total subscribers than Verizon and nearly as many as AT&T,” Fritzsche says in her note. “In fact, this may be one of the largest impediments to a deal being approved—the industry would become even more concentrated, with T-Mobile/Sprint having a dominant competitive position among ‘value’ postpaid and prepaid subscribers.”
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 83 Comments
  • SKYAY

    Pension funds agitate on price in likely Fox/Sky deal

    • Amid stirring for a higher price in what looks like a friendly takeover of Sky (OTCPK:SKYAY) by Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX +0.9%, FOXA +0.6%), public sector pension funds in the UK are calling for an "appropriate" premium and protections for minority shareholders.
    • "All directors of Sky have a duty not to disadvantage the public shareholders, and the position of the non-executives will need to be robust to ensure that the premium paid is appropriate and that shareholders are not disadvantaged by any temporary low in the share price," says Kieran Quinn of the Local Authority Pension Fund Forum.
    • Quinn also called on regulator Ofcom to scrutinize the deal.
    • Fox looks to be closing in on a £10.75/share cash offer for Sky in a friendly setup via a scheme of arrangement, pointing to a cozy relationship between Sky and Fox, which already owns 39% of the broadcaster.
    • Sky is trading up 1.7% to 988.5 pence in London.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM

  • AUPH

    Aurinia Pharma on go with single pivotal study to support voclosporin marketing application for lupus nephritis; shares ahead 10% premarket

    • Aurinia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AUPH) is up 10% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that its will be launching a single Phase 3 study, AURORA, that will support a New Drug Application (NDA) in the U.S. seeking approval of lead product candidate voclosporin for the treatment of lupus nephritis, a Fast Track indication. Just-received minutes from its end-of-Phase 2 meeting with the agency back the plan and are consistent with earlier verbal feedback.
    • Enrollment in the 320-subject, 52-week AURORA study should commence in Q2 2017. The primary endpoint is the same as the Phase 2b AURA trial: renal response (complete remission) at week 24. Secondary endpoints include the duration of response at 52 weeks.
    • Voclosporin suppresses the immune system by inhibiting an enzyme called calcineurin, which activates T cells. Its value proposition is similar effectiveness to other calcineurin inhibitors (cyclosporin and tacrolimus) without the deleterious side effects.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 7 Comments

  • ELGX

    Regulators pull CE Mark from Endologix's AFX system; shares down 10% premarket

    • Endologix (NASDAQ:ELGX) slips 10% premarket on modest volume in response to its disclosure that the Notified Body in the European Union has notified it that it is suspending CE Mark certification for its AFX system due to reports of Type III (device separation) endoleaks with a earlier generation of the device.
    • The company says its has implemented device and graft material improvements and updated instructions for use that have substantially reduced reported Type III endoleaks. No reports of Type III endoleaks have been reported with its next generation AFX2 product.
    • Management expects CE Mark certification to be reinstated next month.
    • AFX and AFX2 remain available in the U.S., Japan and other international markets. They are used to repair an abdominal aortic aneurysm.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM

  • PRTO

    Proteon's lead product candidate flunks late-stage study in chronic kidney disease; shares plummet 73% premarket

    • A Phase 3 clinical trial, PATENCY-1, assessing Proteon Therapeutics' (NASDAQ:PRTO) lead product candidate vonapanitase in patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) failed to achieve its primary endpoint of improved unassisted patency compared to placebo (p=0.254).
    • The primary endpoint was primary unassisted patency defined as the length of time from fistula surgical creation to the firs occurrence of a fistula thrombosis (blood clot) or corrective procedure to restore/maintain patency (blood flow). Results showed patients receiving vonapanitase experienced a 17% reduction in the risk of primary unassisted patency loss over one year versus placebo. At the end of one year, 42% of vonapanitase-treated patients retained primary unassisted patency compared to 31% for placebo.
    • The company says data from the secondary endpoint and one of the tertiary endpoints offer some hope that vonapanitase may be effective by other criteria.
    • Fast Track- and Orphan Drug-designated vonapanitase is a recombinant human elastase, an enzyme that breaks down elastin, an elastic fiber that, together with collagen, determines the structure of connective tissue.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 8?30 am ET to discuss the results.
    • Shares are down 73% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM
